description: Name of the person entering data.
Year, month, and day  of the data entry.
Descriptive name of location where sample was collected
Full name of country where sample was collected, no abbreviations.
Full name of the state or province where the sample was collected. If there are multiple states (i.e. a lake is in Idaho and Utah), then separate with a comma (,).
Latitude of site location where sample was collected.
Longitude of site location where sample was collected.
The type of ecosystem where the sample was collected.
values: Lake, Reservoir, Stream, Wetland, River, Saline Lake, Pond, Coastal, NA

description: Ecosystem trophic state
Meters above sea level.
Additional notes related to the sample location data.
Year the sample was collected (0 if the year is unkown/not reported).
Month the sample was collected (0 if the month is unknown/not reported).
Day the sample was collected (0 if the day is unknown/not reported).
Describes the aquatic habitat from which the sample was collected during the sample event, at the specific unique site ID.
values: Benthic, Littoral, Riparian, Pelagic, Pelagic - epilimnion, Pelagic - hypolimnion, Pelagic - metalimnion, NA

description: Depth the sample was collected.
Air Temperature at time of collection in degrees Celsius.
Temperature of water at time of collection at the most representative location in degrees Celsius.
Cloud cover as a percentage.
Canopy cover as a percentage.
Measurement of light levels at time of collection at the most representative location.
Units in which light levels were measured in (list: micromole per second and square meter [umol_m2_s1], lumen [lm] or lumens per square meter[lm_m2])
Additional notes related to the sample event data.
Type of organism being sampled for stoichiometry data.
values: Fish, Insecta, Mollusca, Annelida, Amphibian, Crustacean, Periphyton, Seston, Detritus (FPOM), Detritus (CPOM), Detritus (Other), Macrophyte, Bryophyte, Zooplankton, Invertebrates (Other), Microbial (Other), Other, NA

description: Original source location of the organism being measured. For example, indicate "benthic" if your sample was collected from the bottom of a lake.
values: Benthic, Sestonic, Epipsammic, Epiphyte, Epixylon, Epilithon, Epizootic, Epipelon, NA

description: Identify the trophic mode of your sample.
values: photoautotroph, chemoautotroph, herbivore, omnivore, carnivore, detritivore, saprotroph, other

description: Organism's taxonomic kingdom.
values: Archaebacteria, Eubacteria, Protista, Chromista, Fungi, Plantae, Animalia

description: Organism's taxonomic order. "NA" for unknown or for multiple known orders.
Organism's taxonomic family. "NA" for unknown or for multiple known families.
Taxonomic Genus of organism. "NA"  for multiple genera, known or unknown.
Species epithet of organism. "sp" for single unknown species. Indicate "spp" for multiple species, known or unknown.
How individual organism(s) were pooled for the sample.
Whether a given observation is statistically pooled or not. Is this observation from one raw independent measure of a sample, or summarizing multiple observations.
Number of individual (statistical) samples contributing to measurement (e.g. a mean) for the sampling event.
Name of developmental stage, i.e. pupa, if applicable.
Did the sample organism(s) have their guts cleared or removed. i.e. caddisflies often have their guts removed before whole-body element analysis occurs.
Measured value.
Type of organism mass measurement.
Units used in organism mass measurement.
values: kg, g, mg, ug, mg_L, ug_L, mg_cm2, ug_cm2, g_m2, mg_m2, NA

description: Additional notes related to organism mass.
Indicate whether the elemental measurements or stoichiometric values are representative of the entire organism (whole_organism) or only part of the organism (partial_organism).
If the sample was "partial_organism", what part of the organism was sampled for these elemental measurements?
The amount of carbon measured in the sample.
The standard deviation of carbon.

values: percent_dm, mg_g_dm, ug_g_dm, umol_L, mg_L, mg_cm2, ug_L, ug_cm2, NA

carbon to nitrogen molar ratio
carbon to phosphorus molar ratio
nitrogen to phosphorus molar ratio

Carbon 13 isotope . Must be on Vienna Pee Dee Belemnite (VPDB) scale.
